content.description: Short but sweet, with lots of side pulls and lie backs. Start hold is a lie back on the left side of the wall, about hip height. Finishes on a side pull about 11 feet directly above the finish, on a side pull in the crack (see photo).
content.location: In the same alley as "Alley Cat", but on the overhanging wall directly in front.

content.description:
Lie back start on a large, lever-shaped hold.  Follow crimps of various sizes heading towards the right side of the wall.  Once you reach the small ledge on the far right (not pictured), start heading left towards the finish, where the rock comes to a point at the top.  See photo for more information.

Mostly pretty good footholds, the crux is about halfway up involving a hand cross to a crimp in the horizontal crack.
content.protection: Flat ground with plenty of room for bouldering pads. Spotter recommended.
content.location: On the crimpy slab on the left side of the climbing area.
